posts.post_content:
For starters, I had no idea that any of those [Cartel Aristocrat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cartel Aristocrat)s were actually vampires, which does a lot to explain their abilities.  
  
I'll be incredibly happy to get one of these if I end up with BGW at the pre-release. Each side of the card is pretty decent in and of itself as a combat trick, but when combined, the card essentially reads, *2GWWB: You're losing? Now you're winning!"*

Posted By: DarthParallax (4/24/2013 2:02:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Is anyone else annoyed by the color combinations of the five fuse cards? I'm glad that enemy tri-color decks are getting more cards, but they created a bit of an imbalance.   
Each wedge had:  
1. A card from apocalypse   
2. A legendary dragon  
3. Two mythic legendaries  
  
The only outlying cards before Dragon's Maze were [Doran, the Siege Tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doran, the Siege Tower) and [Maelstrom Wanderer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Wanderer). this left a slight imbalance. with the release of this card however, W/B/G now has two more than W/B/R and U/B/G, and B/R/G and W/B/R have an additional card. Hopefully Wizards will print more enemy wedge cards, and this entire rant will be obsoleted, but for now, I had to get this out.
posts.html:
Is anyone else annoyed by the color combinations of the five fuse cards? I'm glad that enemy tri-color decks are getting more cards, but they created a bit of an imbalance.
Each wedge had:
1. A card from apocalypse
2. A legendary dragon
3. Two mythic legendaries

The only outlying cards before Dragon's Maze were Doran, the Siege Tower and Maelstrom Wanderer. this left a slight imbalance. with the release of this card however, W/B/G now has two more than W/B/R and U/B/G, and B/R/G and W/B/R have an additional card. Hopefully Wizards will print more enemy wedge cards, and this entire rant will be obsoleted, but for now, I had to get this out.
